skill.name: json-validator
skill.description: Validate, format, and fix JSON data. Use this skill when working with JSON files, API responses, or configuration files that need validation or formatting.
skill.summary: Validate, format, and fix JSON data. Use this skill when working with JSON files, API responses, or ...
skill.author: Alon2904

security_audit.summary: This is a pure prompt-based skill with no code execution, file access, or network capabilities. The skill provides only instructions for AI agents to help users validate, format, and fix JSON data.

content.value_statement: JSON syntax errors cause bugs and integration failures. This skill validates JSON structure, fixes common errors like trailing commas and unquoted keys, and formats data cleanly.
actual_capabilities: Validate JSON syntax with precise line numbers
Fix common JSON errors (trailing commas, single quotes)
Convert JSON to YAML, TOML, CSV, and XML formats
Analyze JSON structure and report schema information
Provide clear error messages with suggested corrections
limitations: Cannot directly read or write files on your system
Does not handle extremely large JSON files efficiently

use_cases.title: Debug API responses
use_cases.description: Quickly identify and fix JSON syntax errors in API responses or configuration files.

use_cases.title: Convert data formats
use_cases.description: Transform JSON data into YAML, TOML, or other formats for different systems.

use_cases.title: Validate data structures
use_cases.description: Check JSON payloads for correct structure and identify missing or invalid fields.

prompt_templates.title: Basic validation
prompt_templates.prompt: Validate this JSON and show me any errors with line numbers: [PASTE JSON HERE]

prompt_templates.title: Fix errors
prompt_templates.prompt: Fix the errors in this JSON and show me the corrected version: [PASTE JSON HERE]

prompt_templates.title: Format output
prompt_templates.prompt: Format this JSON with 2-space indentation: [PASTE JSON HERE]

prompt_templates.title: Convert format
prompt_templates.prompt: Convert this JSON to [YAML/TOML/CSV/XML]: [PASTE JSON HERE]

output: Line 3: Trailing comma after last object property

best_practices: Validate before formatting to avoid masking syntax errors
Include line numbers when reporting errors for easier debugging
Preserve original data types and avoid unnecessary string conversions
anti_patterns: Formatting invalid JSON without first fixing syntax errors
Converting JSON to other formats without validating first
Using single quotes instead of double quotes in JSON

faq.question: What JSON validation rules does this skill check?
faq.answer: It checks for syntax errors, missing or extra commas, unclosed brackets, unquoted keys, trailing commas, single quotes, and invalid values like NaN or Infinity.

faq.question: Does this skill support JSON Schema validation?
faq.answer: No, this skill validates basic JSON syntax and structure but does not validate against JSON Schema specifications.

faq.question: Can I use this skill to format large JSON files?
faq.answer: The skill works with JSON of any size, but extremely large files may be slow to process in a single request.

faq.question: What formatting options are available?
faq.answer: The default uses 2-space indentation. You can optionally request alphabetical key sorting or request minimal whitespace.

faq.question: Is my data sent to any external servers?
faq.answer: No, this is a prompt-based skill that runs entirely within your AI tool. No data leaves your system.

faq.question: How does this compare to online JSON validators?
faq.answer: This skill works offline, provides immediate feedback, integrates with your workflow, and can fix errors automatically rather than just reporting them.
